p: Overview: The genus, Calendula (Asteraceae), is native to the Mediterranean countries and includes approximately 25 herbaceous annual or perennial species; the most common are Calendula officinalis Linn., Calendula arvensis Linn., C. suffruticosa Vahl., C. stellata Cav., C. alata Rech., and C. tripterocarpa Rupr. [ 134, 135].
